      • addElement

        public JsonDot addElement​(String path,
                          Object value)
                   throws org.json.JSONException
        Adds a value at the specified path using dot notation, auto-creating missing paths
        Parameters:
        path - Dot notation path (e.g., "parent1.parent2.child")
        value - Value to add
        Returns:
        this JsonDot instance for method chaining
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if the path is invalid

      • removeElementFromAllPaths

        public List<Object> removeElementFromAllPaths​(String path)
                                       throws org.json.JSONException
        Removes an element at all matching paths using dot notation
        Parameters:
        path - Dot notation path (e.g., "*.child" or "parent1.parent2.child")
        Returns:
        List of removed values
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if the path is invalid

      • hasPath

        public boolean hasPath​(String path)
        Checks if a path exists in the JSON object. The path can include array indices like "parent1.array[0].child" or wildcards like "parent1.array[*].child".
        Parameters:
        path - The path to check
        Returns:
        true if the path exists, false otherwise

      • suggestPaths

        public List<String> suggestPaths​(String partialPath)
        Suggests possible path completions based on a partial path.
        Parameters:
        partialPath - The partial path to get suggestions for. If null or empty, returns all top-level keys.
        Returns:
        A List of suggested complete paths that match the partial path.

      • query

        public List<Object> query​(String pattern)
        Queries JSON using wildcard patterns
        Parameters:
        pattern - The wildcard pattern (e.g., "user.*.city")
        Returns:
        List of matching values

      • addElementToArray

        public JsonDot addElementToArray​(String path,
                                 String key,
                                 Object value)
                          throws org.json.JSONException
        Adds a value to all elements in an array at the specified path
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the array (e.g., "user.contacts")
        key - The key to add to each array element
        value - The value to add
        Returns:
        this JsonDot instance for method chaining
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if the path is invalid or does not point to an array
